result.execSummary:
The defendant Marco A Lopez Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).
  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).
  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).
  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
With Dodge Correctional Institution designated as the reception Center with credit for 93 days time served.

Defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. Defendant remanded.

- Register as a sex offender

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marco A Lopez in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Marco A Lopez in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Statements by state and defense; defendant does not make a statement.
Due to the date of offenses in all 4 counts, this is an OLD LAW sentence.
AS to count 1:   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 10 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons with Dodge Correctional Institution designated as the reception center with credit for 93 days time served.
AS to count 2:   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to count 1.
AS to count 3:   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 10 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to count 2.
AS to count 4:   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to count 3.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b);  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs;
-Register as a sex offender;
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Defendant remanded.  
FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
             Pretrial Credit
             Notice of Voting Ineligibility

(4)GUILTY

COURT REPORTER Lisa Weninger, case recalled.  All parties are present in court.
Jury in the box at 1:15pm.  Testimony of defendant resumes.  Defense rests.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  EXHIBITS 1; 100-105 received.  Jury out of the box at 1:40pm.  Jury instructions placed on the record and agreed to by counsels and defendant.  Jury in the box at 2:20pm.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Rebuttal argument by the state.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot (#19 ) and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:15pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Zielinski and Spottek who were duly sworn for that purpose. 
At the hour of 4:10pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson(#17), brought in the following verdicts:
Count 1:  We, the jury find the defendant GUILTY of Sexual Assault of a Child under 13 years of age
Count 2:  We, the jury find the defendant GUILTY of Sexual Assault of a Child under 13 years of age
Count 3:  We, the jury find the defendant GUILTY of Sexual Assault of a Child under 13 years of age
Count 4:  We, the jury find the defendant GUILTY of Sexual Assault of a Child under 13 years of age
Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction.  Court orders a PSI and remands the defendant pending sentencing on 6-23-2016 at 8:15am.
Filed:
Verdicts (4)
Jury Instructions
Exhibit list

Jury in the box at 10:50am.  Sworn for the defense:  Marco L., Sr.  Court recesses for lunch and directs jury and counsels to appear at 1:00pm.  Jury out of the box at 11:25am.

Defendant Marco A Lopez in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information is filed by the state as to penalty sections as to each count.  Defense acknowledges receipt and waives reading.
Juryin the box and sworn at 9:25am. The court instructs the jury.  Opening statements by counsels.  Sworn for the state:  Obdila Beatriz L; Marco L. Jr.  Jury out of the box at 11:45am.  Court directs the jury to return at 1:10pm  Sidebars placed on the record.
All parties are present in court.  Jury in the box at 1:20pm.  Sworn for the state:  Sonia L; Tamara R.  Jury out of the box at 2:35pm  Jury in the box at 2:50pm.  Sworn for the state:  Det. Sarah Blomme(MPD).  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of the box at 3:25pm.
SECOND Corrected information filed by the state with correct dates for each count
COUNT 1: January 1 1992 and December 31, 1994
COUNT 2: January 1, 1994 and December 31, 1997
COUNT 3:  January 1, 1994 and December 31, 1997
COUNT 4:  January 1, 1998 and September 24, 2000
Defense acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Defense motion to dismiss is argued and DENIED.
Colloquy between the court and defendant as to his decision TO TESTIFY in his own behalf; the court finds it to be a free and voluntary decision.  Defense counsel informs the court that there are 4 defense witnesses that will be present at 9am on 4-27-2016 and the defendant wishes to testify after the other witnesses.  The court releases the jury from the jury room and via court deputy  directs them to return at 9am on 4-27-2016.

Defendant Marco A Lopez in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case spun from Branch 2 for jury trial today.  
In chambers discussion held.  Back on the record.  The state's offer is placed on the record and REJECTED by the defendant.  Jury trial to proceed.
In chambers discussion held.  Back on the record.  The state will be filing an amended information with the correct penalty enhancers as to counts 2 and 4.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  3:00pm.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury is excused for the day and directed to report at 9am on 4-26-2016.  Court admonished the jury not to conduct any independent investigation.  Strikes for cause placed on the record.  Jury trial scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Hearing on Motion to Introduce Other Acts proceeds.  Arguments by counesl.  Court finds the charges are not too remote and is not unfairly prejudice to the defendant and allows the State to use the other acts to show motive and plan. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marco A Lopez in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Marco A Lopez in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defense raises an issue with the maximum penalties as specified in the Complaint. State advises the Court that the maximum penalties listed may be related to the date of the offenses.  Court informed the parties and the Defendant this this issue will be addressed at the Preliminary Hearing. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties as currently specified in the Complaint, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
